title: What is the best guitar solo you have ever heard? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Hitch a Ride” by Boston. The best written & orchestrated guitar solo of our time. Multiple guitars, some in harmony, answering each other back in each bar. Great Les Paul tones, at least three different ones, maybe more. Warm, Fuzzy, and Sharp. Tons of sustain & perfect bends. And best of all, a melody & hook all their own that’s totally unique and removed from the precreceeding vocal arrangement. The solo is at the end of the song. Oddly enough, the middle solo is on organ, played by the same man, Tom Scholz - highly underrated as a rock organist. The organ solo actually “rocks” more than the guitar solo! This guitar solo melody is as much a signature of the song as the vocal, as in much of his work. A melody you will hum to yourself long after the song is over. That is the critera for a great solo - NOT speed or tricks. Other answers think guitar is a competition. Nope - it’s all about music - and what pleases the heart, soul, mind, & ears. Along these lines, many “corporate rock” players have the gift. Check out Neal Schon on Journey’s “Who’s Crying Now” or “Stone In Love” - which both have a similar “whole ‘nother song” ending, with guitar melodies you can hum in the shower. He’s obviously a student of Santana, who should get a mention here too. “Europa” is now a classic melody, but is an instrumental really a solo? (Is it in the big book yet?) On the orchestration side, I would also reccomend “That Smell” from Lynyrd Skynyrd. A truly horrible song with the most thought out guitar solos ever recorded. Not so hummable, but a signature of the song, and a tour de force of “lead break” composition. Trading licks, multiple breakdowns, & continually building intensity make you totally forget all about the dopey lyrics. (Dopey - get it? Hahaha. ) Dare I say Better than Free Bird, and much more concise. Guitar playing is not about speed, kids.

Hmmm, that is an interesting question. I will try to answer this as best I can. I have an eclectic taste in music. The solos I am about to list below, I like for different reasons. Comfortably Numb-Pink Floyd, love the mood of the outro soloKid Charlemagne-Steely Dan, Love the middle soloWhite my guitar gently weeps-The Beatles: Love Eric Clapton’s outro.Shine on you crazy diamond-Pink Floyd, just pure soulfulness.Phantom-Al DiMeola-Great jazz fusion instrumental.Europa-Santana-Pure soul here.Dolphin Dreams-Lee RitenhourMessiah will come again-Roy BuchananHey Joe-Jimi Hendrix: Especially some live versionsDown by the River-Roy BuchananThrill is gone-B B King: Good example how less can be more.I know you may have been looking for more shred like answers but those type of guitar solos don’t appeal to me. I am more from the blues and jazz school. As a guitarist, I tend to prefer playing melodies on the guitar.
